attributes.action: This Government must cancel any planned cuts to the funding of Police Dogs.
attributes.background:
An example of the value of Police Dogs was presented in the House of Commons by Sir Oliver Heald on the 5th Dec 2017, who proposed 'Finns Law' 2nd reading 23rd Feb 2018.  
He underlined the value of Police Dogs.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Funding for police dogs is an operational decision for the local Police and Crime Commissioner (except in London and Greater Manchester where the Mayor performs this function). 

You could raise this issue with your local Police and Crime Commissioner who is elected. You can find out who they are and how to contact them here: 

http://www.apccs.police.uk/find-your-pcc/
